title: talkoncrypto Official
author: talkoncrypto Official
created_time: October 11, 2022, 02:57:51 PMLast edit: October 11, 2022, 03:20:22 PM by talkoncrypto Official
content: Bitcoin is not just a digital currency , but a revolution and for some its like following a religion ... Days on which bitcoin is celebrated .. Here are some which i mentioned , if somehow missed any please feel free to add ...  and also share your opinion about what you feel about specific days out of this list ... Have u ever contributed or u have any experience of any of such days ...January 3 -     Bitcoin Day January 11 - Bitcoin Running Day January 27 - Silk Road DayFebruary 24 - Mt.Gox Day March 9 - Cypherpunk Day April 5 - Satoshi's DayMay 10 - Lightning Day May 22 - Bitcoin Pizza Day August 1st- Bitcoin Independence Day August 21- Bitcoin Infinity Day October 31 - Bitcoin Whitepaper Day November 4 - Bitcoin Logo Day November 8 - Shitcoin Day December 18 - HODL Day

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: talkoncrypto Official on October 11, 2022, 02:57:51 PMBitcoin is not just a digital currency , but a revolution and for some its like following a religion ... Days on which bitcoin is celebrated .. Here are some which i mentioned , if somehow missed any please feel free to add ...  and also share your opinion about what you feel about specific days out of this list ... Have u ever contributed or u have any experience of any of such days ...There is already a nicely written calendar that covers most of this (and more), see https://bitcoin.holiday/ and some sort of announcement here.Of course, Cypherpunk Day is not directly bitcoin related and also Satoshi day is most probably incorrect - I guess you don't expect a man very careful about his privacy would give out the correct birth date just like that..If you feel you can add dates, you can also contribute there: https://bitcoin.holiday/

comments.author: noormcs5
comments.body: Quote from: talkoncrypto Official on October 11, 2022, 02:57:51 PMBitcoin is not just a digital currency , but a revolution and for some its like following a religion ... Days on which bitcoin is celebrated .. Here are some which i mentioned , if somehow missed any please feel free to add ...  and also share your opinion about what you feel about specific days out of this list ... Have u ever contributed or u have any experience of any of such days ...January 3 -     Bitcoin Day January 11 - Bitcoin Running Day January 27 - Silk Road DayFebruary 24 - Mt.Gox Day March 9 - Cypherpunk Day April 5 - Satoshi's DayMay 10 - Lightning Day May 22 - Bitcoin Pizza Day August 21- Bitcoin Infinity Day October 31 - Bitcoin Whitepaper Day November 8 - Shitcoin Day December 18 - HODL Day To be very honest, i don't know most of these days expect a few. Even i don't see people talking about them on those days mentioned.Among all these days, it was bitcoin pizza day which is known to everyone and some of people celebrate it too. I have seen people share the bitcoin pizza day pictures here on bitcointalk where they have decorated pizza with some bitcoin designs and celebrated.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Really all what matters is the Bitcoin halving and whatever upcoming estimated dates we have for important softfork updates — everything else is just meh.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: talkoncrypto Official on October 11, 2022, 02:57:51 PMBitcoin is not just a digital currency , but a revolution and for some its like following a religion ... Days on which bitcoin is celebrated .. Here are some which i mentioned , if somehow missed any please feel free to add ...  and also share your opinion about what you feel about specific days out of this list ... Have u ever contributed or u have any experience of any of such days ...January 3 -     Bitcoin Day April 5 - Satoshi's DayMay 10 - Lightning Day May 22 - Bitcoin Pizza Day August 1st- Bitcoin Independence Day August 21- Bitcoin Infinity Day October 31 - Bitcoin Whitepaper Day November 4 - Bitcoin Logo Day November 8 - Shitcoin Day December 18 - HODL Day For, I am only familiar with "Bitcoin pizza day" which represents the day an individual bought two pizzas with over 10,000 Bitcoins worth $40 back then, and I have no idea about the rest. But I think there are some days here that make no sense and I don't see any reason why they are important to Bitcoin in any way, such as Independence Day, Bitcoin Infinity Day, Bitcoin Whitepaper Day, Bitcoin Logo Day, Bitcoin Day, and HODL-day. Because I think these days makes no sense, but it would have nice if only had you explained it a more better

comments.author: melody82
comments.body: I always like new reasons to party. Pick a day where nothing else is going on, and your boss will probably not give you time off lol.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: What I know is that an event in the "Bitcoin Pizza Day" Calendar has become a lot of stories in the community because buying two Pizzas with 10,000 Bitcoin first then this becomes an unforgettable memory and people always celebrate this day as a sacred day in Bitcoin.Many people always imagine that the price of Bitcoin is now but the fact is that was what someone who liked pizza did in the past.For other Days I can't pay attention much more except Bitcoin Pizza Day, even my wife always make Pizza on that day.

comments.author: talkoncrypto Official
comments.body: Quote from: ajiz138 on October 11, 2022, 05:36:10 PMWhat I know is that an event in the "Bitcoin Pizza Day" Calendar has become a lot of stories in the community because buying two Pizzas with 10,000 Bitcoin first then this becomes an unforgettable memory and people always celebrate this day as a sacred day in Bitcoin.Many people always imagine that the price of Bitcoin is now but the fact is that was what someone who liked pizza did in the past.For other Days I can't pay attention much more except Bitcoin Pizza Day, even my wife always make Pizza on that day. This is what is expected from a true bitcoin enthusiast.. sounds pretty amazing .. that you actually have pizza on that day … Thanks for sharing for sharing experience…

comments.author: nullama
comments.body: Here's a nice looking calendar with Bitcoin dates:https://bitcoin.holidayYou can subscribe to it and see the events in your own calendar.You can also contribute to it by adding missing dates here: https://github.com/coinkite/bitcoin.holiday.pub

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: talkoncrypto Official on October 11, 2022, 02:57:51 PMNovember 8 - Shitcoin Day I don't know about this day lol. It's my first time sighting it unlike the others.What's the story behind it. it would also been awesome if the year the actual event happened and the links to the story behind the even were included on each important Bitcoin day.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Actually, there's a calendar that listed all Bitcoin activities and important days.https://bitcoin.holiday (edited: ohh, it's given above already)I didn't even know that there are more holidays in the Bitcoin calendar.  I always think about a new ATH will come every 4 years come not the monthly activities on Bitcoin in the calendar.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I'm not so familiar with some of these Bitcoin holidays. What is Bitcoin Running Day, for example? And also, if it is strictly a Bitcoin holiday calendar, I guess I would omit the likes of Mt. Gox Day or Shitcoin Day. Anyway, the good thing with Bitcoin.holiday, which others have suggested above, is that it provides a brief information about the particular holiday. But, again, there are still days there which I think are not really that relevant in Bitcoin's history that they need to be considered holidays.

comments.author: rendravolt
comments.body: There are many important days about bitcoin in each month. It's October now which means we will soon be celebrating bitcoin whitepaper day and that's really awesome for me. With the birth of a new decentralized history, people around the world were amazed. Elsewhere I also like bitcoin pizza day sounds very funny but that was the beginning of the first bitcoin transaction used as a means of payment for a pizza.
